pages.text: Things were definitely easier when my friends lived closer. Taking care of myself, especially in this state, is a struggle. $(br2)I find myself thinking out loud as if my friends far away can hear me, which... is silly. Even sillier is when I think my thoughts $(o)silently$() as if they can hear me.
It should be obvious, but $(n)without tools, friends need to be close if they're to hear me.$(br2)Lately I've just been sitting $(l)('<')$() or lying $(l)('C')$() around a lot.

pages.title: Giving and Receiving
pages.text: I'm glad we set up a mail system before they left. Now, assuming they have a postbox of their own, they can reach me at any time if I have a mailbox.$(br2)I'm not $(o)totally$() sure how the post box works, but anything I put in seems to find the right place. I think.

Speaking in an empty room is a lot less awkward when you know your voice is being transmitted where it needs to go. I think my friends accidentally tune into the wrong frequency from time to time, though.
